intro: Pleuroplitis langsdorffii var. japonica, commonly known as the Japanese pleurostigma, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
